intro: Hibiscus brasiliensis var. genuinus, commonly known as the Brazilian hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are usually hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Hibiscus brasiliensis var. genuinus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
